intro: Kuestera, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, waxy leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. Kuestera has a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas efficiently.
